alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 10:47AM CDT until June 03 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Denton Creek Near Justin affecting Denton County. .Minor flooding to low lands along the immediate creek bank through Friday morning. For the Denton Creek...including Justin...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Denton Creek Near Justin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor out of bank flooding will occur to farm and ranch lands near the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 11.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
